summary: This document outlines the terms of the Jeffrey E. Epstein 2012 Trust Agreement, detailing the roles of the Grantor, Jeffrey E. Epstein, and the Trustees, Darren K. Indyke, James E. Staley, and Andrew Farkas. It specifies the management and distribution of the trust's assets during and after Epstein's lifetime, including specific bequests to various individuals.

keyFacts: The trust agreement was executed on October 24, 2012.
Jeffrey E. Epstein has reserved the right to amend or revoke the trust at any time.
Specific bequests of $5,000,000 each are made to several individuals, including Ghislaine N. Maxwell and Jean Luc Brunel.
The trust includes provisions for the payment of debts, taxes, and expenses after Epstein's death.
Several individuals are listed as debtors whose loans Epstein forgives.
